intro: Oreocharis villosa, commonly known as the hairy oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Oreocharis villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes.
